org.prolog4j
Interface IProverFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProverFactory, JLogProverFactory, JTrologProverFactory, SWIPrologProverFactory, TuPrologProverFactory
public interface IProverFactory

IProverFactory instances manufacture Prover instances by name.

Most users retrieve Prover instances through the static ProverFactory.getProver(String) method. An instance of this interface is bound internally with ProverFactory class at compile time.

Method Summary
Modifier and Type Method and Description
 ConversionPolicy createConversionPolicy()
          Creates a new conversion policy.
 ConversionPolicy getConversionPolicy()
          Returns the conversion policy used by provers at default.
 Prover getProver()
          Creates a new prover.

          Returns an appropriate Prover instance as specified by the name parameter.
 

Method Detail

getProver

Prover getProver()
Creates a new prover.

Returns:
a new prover

getProver

Prover getProver(String name)
Returns an appropriate Prover instance as specified by the name parameter. It provides the same prover instance for the same name whenever you call it.

Null-valued name arguments are considered invalid.

Parameters:
name - the name of the prover to return
Returns:
a prover instance with the specified name

getConversionPolicy

ConversionPolicy getConversionPolicy()
Returns the conversion policy used by provers at default. The modification of this policy effects all provers. The policy can also be customized on a per prover base by getting their own policy.

Returns:
the default conversion policy

createConversionPolicy

ConversionPolicy createConversionPolicy()
Creates a new conversion policy.

Returns:
the created conversion policy
